questions.question: I may leave tomorrow. /James said that he ......................... leave the next day.
questions.description: May in direct speech becomes might in indirect speech.

questions.question: I am busy now. / Rahul said that he ............................ busy then.
questions.description: Simple present in direct speech becomes simple past in indirect speech.

questions.question: You are sacked. / The manager said that I ............................ sacked.
questions.description: Simple present in direct speech becomes simple past in indirect speech.

questions.question: What are you doing there? / He asked me what ............................... doing there.
questions.description: In reported questions, the subject goes before the auxiliary verb.

questions.question: You are a great mentor. / I told him that he ........................ a great mentor.
questions.description: Simple present in direct speech becomes simple past in indirect speech.

questions.question: We might go camping next week. / She told me that ............................. might go camping the following week.
I am leaving. / She told me that she .................................
questions.description: Present continuous in the direct speech becomes past continuous in the indirect speech.

questions.question: Who are you? / The watchman asked me who ....................................
The exhibition ended yesterday. / The tourist guide told me that the exhibition ............................. the previous day.
questions.description: Simple past in direct speech becomes past perfect in indirect speech.

questions.question: Let's go for a walk. / He said that they ................................... for a walk.
Close the door. / He ordered me ........................... the door.
questions.description: Imperatives are usually reported with a to-infinitive.

questions.question: Be careful. / She advised me ................................ careful.
